intro: Tetramolopium alinae, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Tetramolopium alinae is often found in coastal and upland habitats, showcasing its adaptability to the unique environmental conditions of Hawaii.
